bug.short_desc: Allow URLs for use with the @see attribute

long_desc.thetext:
It seems that the @see attribute only allows internal references at the moment (to other classes, methods, properties, ...).
It would be nice if the @see attribute can also handle external urls to have a default way to link to external documentation (e.g. specifications, RFC, ...)

Hey, you can just past the URL and the API viewer will automatically convert it to a link in the docs. That is even easier and more convenient and distinguishes the internal from the external links. Is there any reason i don't see why the @see link should also support external links? Best, Martin

Hey,
I understood the @see attribute as a general tag to link to other documentation resources. I currently working with qooxdoo on node.js and wrapped some modules to get the full qooxdoo flavour. I searched for a solution to link to the node.js documentation for the wrapped methods.
At the moment I write in every documentation: *See also:* http://....
This works but I thought there must be a better solution and found the @see attribute.
Cheers, Leo
I'm sorry but there currently is none and considering all the possibilities how someone could want to have that URL presented, I think its best to stick to the plain URL in that case.
